channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Abuse in care: Former Wesley College student describes beatings, abuse
item.description: A former student of Wesley College has spoken emotionally of physical abuse, including severe beatings, bullying and extreme violence at the boarding school near Pukekohe.

item.title: Booze tops New Zealand exports to Antarctica
item.description: New Zealand has exported $80,000 worth of stuffed toys, almost $20,000 worth of chocolate and a staggering $1.5 million worth of alcohol to Antarctica since 1990.

item.title: Unions call for sick leave to be available from day one of employment
item.description: From tomorrow, changes to double minimum sick leave entitlements from five to 10 days come into effect, but workers are only eligible once they have been in a job six months.

item.title: Trans-Tasman bubble: Cabinet considers closing travel to Australia
item.description: Cabinet ministers have convened a special virtual meeting this afternoon to discuss the trans-Tasman bubble, including a potential pause of the entire arrangement.

item.title: Crew from Mattina ship have delta variant of Covid-19
item.description: Results show nine of the Covid-19 positive crew members aboard the Mattina container ship in Bluff have the more infectious delta variant.

item.title: Abuse in care inquiry hears from former Ōwairaka Boys' Home watchman
item.description: A witness at the inquiry into abuse in care has revealed seeing a boy being beaten to a near pulp at the Ōwairaka Boys' Home in 1970.

item.title: Trade minister not expecting retaliation from China over cyber attacks criticism
item.description: Days after New Zealand joined its Western allies in firing a warning shot across China's bows, the trade minister says security and trade are separate issues.

item.title: Pharmacy offering patients their shot along side prescriptions
item.description: At Pakūranga Unichem you can pick up your prescription, and get a Covid-19 vaccine while you wait.

item.title: DHBs face billion dollar bill for incorrect leave payments
item.description: District Health Boards could owe as much as $1.1 billion to current and former staff in incorrect annual leave payments, and that amount continues to grow.

item.title: Sewage flowing into Porirua harbour after pipe bursts again
item.description: Sewage is overflowing into Porirua harbour after a wastewater main on State Highway One burst again.

item.title: Injured sharks and turtle trouble at Napier's National Aquarium
item.description: Sharks with sore noses, water filter breakdowns and a turtle welfare petition. What's going on at the National Aquarium of New Zealand?

item.title: Vaccination effort may need to go airborne, Māori health boss says
item.description: An Eastern Bay of Plenty Māori health provider is considering helicoptering the Covid-19 vaccine out to isolated communities.

item.title: Egg testing programme expanded after recent detection of salmonella strain
item.description: A programme to determine the safety of eggs is to be expanded.

item.title: Covid-19 vaccine benefit clearly outweighs heart inflammation risk increase - research
item.description: Heart inflammation may be a rare side effect of the Pfizer vaccine, particularly for young men, Medsafe says, but the Covid-19 vaccine is safer than the alternative.

item.title: Stranded orca calf to be moved from pool back into sea pen
item.description: The stranded orca calf being cared for in Porirua is being moved out of a temporary pool and into the sea pen for health reasons.

item.title: Interactive artwork on Quay Street opens to the public
item.description: Auckland's downtown waterfront has been gifted a new installment woven in to the landscape of the popular seaside walkway - carrying an important message about the health of the city's surrounding waters.

item.title: Kiwi killed by dog, thrown down bank in Taranaki conservation area
item.description: A kiwi bird has been killed by a dog on conservation land in Taranaki.

item.title: How ordinary Kiwi cyclists started being seen as ‘elitist’
item.description: The Conversation: Something strange has happened to the perception of cyclists and cycling - one of the cheapest and most eco-friendly ways to get around has been labelled 'elitist'.
